update.description:
This PR makes possible to use Ogre2 with camera example and camera tests.

It is inspired from on going work on using ogre2 and ogre1 at the same time with [ign-rendering](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/115/enable-ogre2-tests/diff).

It is also possible to select which engine should be used for the tests like it is done [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/124/work-with-new-ogre2-debs/diff). But I added some automatic configurations [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-sensors/pull-requests/25/use-ogre2-with-camera-example-and-tests/diff#Ltest/test_config.h.inT14) so the default values are based on which version of Ogre \(1.9 or 2.1\) is installed.
update.title: Use Ogre2 with camera example and tests

content.raw: For this is why I wanted the new [gtest’s skip](https://github.com/google/googletest/pull/1544). I added a “none“ render engine. The test will run and pass, but no rendering engine will be found.
content.html: For this is why I wanted the new gtest’s skip. I added a “none“ render engine. The test will run and pass, but no rendering engine will be found.

pull_request.title: Use Ogre2 with camera example and tests

pullrequest.title: Use Ogre2 with camera example and tests

content.raw:
There is an issue in ign-redering when the engine is unloaded.  

    Thread 1 "INTEGRATION_dep" received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
    0x00007fffefd75338 in ignition::rendering::v1::OgreRenderTargetMaterial::~OgreRenderTargetMaterial (this=0x5555564905b0, __in_chrg=<optimized out>)
        at /home/docker/ignition/ign-rendering/ogre/src/OgreRenderTargetMaterial.cc:38
    38	  this->renderTarget->removeListener(this);

OgreDepthCamera deserves a review after what we have been doing. I will continue with it next when we move it to Ogre2, for now I added a TODO there.
content.html:
There is an issue in ign-redering when the engine is unloaded. 

Thread 1 "INTEGRATION_dep" received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x00007fffefd75338 in ignition::rendering::v1::OgreRenderTargetMaterial::~OgreRenderTargetMaterial (this=0x5555564905b0, __in_chrg=<optimized out>)
    at /home/docker/ignition/ign-rendering/ogre/src/OgreRenderTargetMaterial.cc:38
38    this->renderTarget->removeListener(this);

OgreDepthCamera deserves a review after what we have been doing. I will continue with it next when we move it to Ogre2, for now I added a TODO there.

pull_request.title: Use Ogre2 with camera example and tests

pullrequest.title: Use Ogre2 with camera example and tests

content.raw:
By default it will use ogre2 for tests if it finds ogre2 installed.   
  
It is possible to use ogre 1.9 using `RENDER_ENGINE_VALUES=ogre make test` if ogre2 is installed
content.html:
By default it will use ogre2 for tests if it finds ogre2 installed.

It is possible to use ogre 1.9 using RENDER_ENGINE_VALUES=ogre make test if ogre2 is installed

update.description:
This PR makes possible to use Ogre2 with camera example and camera tests.

It is inspired from on going work on using ogre2 and ogre1 at the same time with [ign-rendering](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/115/enable-ogre2-tests/diff).

It is also possible to select which engine should be used for the tests like it is done [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/124/work-with-new-ogre2-debs/diff). But I added some automatic configurations [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-sensors/pull-requests/25/use-ogre2-with-camera-example-and-tests/diff#Ltest/test_config.h.inT14) so the default values are based on which version of Ogre \(1.9 or 2.1\) is installed.

pull_request.title: Use Ogre2 with camera example and tests

pullrequest.title: Use Ogre2 with camera example and tests

content.raw:
unfortunately there is an [issue](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/issues/36/wrong-ogre-library-loaded-at-runtime-when) running tests with ogre and ogre2 together so I’ve set up ign-rendering tests to run with only [one ogre version](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/src/2d6dfa298f005c720f7ce526b6aa25934ca99f50/test/test_config.h.in#lines-12) by default

As the result, with ogre1.9 and 2.1 installed, I get ogre error when running `INTEGRATION_camera_plugin` test
content.html:
unfortunately there is an issue running tests with ogre and ogre2 together so I’ve set up ign-rendering tests to run with only one ogre version by default

As the result, with ogre1.9 and 2.1 installed, I get ogre error when running INTEGRATION_camera_plugin test
